item.description:
The Dix Range:

Macomb Mountain, South Dix (Carson Peak) and East Dix (Grace Peak).


HIKE IT!


PLEASE -- REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. **NOTE: THIS WEEKEND'S EVENTS ARE HIGHLY WEATHER / TRAIL-CONDITION DEPENDENT.**

EVENT ORGANIZER:  Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT).  Email me with your thoughts about this trip ... you can text me to the above number as well. WORK TOWARD YOUR WINTER ADK LIST WITH US!


Oh no -- another Trifecta!  This trip is in conjunction with the Santanoni Range hike the previous day.  If this turns out to be too much for folks driving round trip from Downstate we can reschedule this.  Post your thoughts in the comments box below.

 
The westward view of the Adirondack High Peaks from the Macomb Slide

 
Mike follows me and friends to the summit of Macomb Mountain


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

Lodging:  This is a weekend trip in conjunction with a hike from the Elk Lake trailhead to Macomb Mountain, South Dix (Carson Peak) and East Dix (Grace Peak).  We have $50 / room rates for a limited number at the Yellow Coach in Schroon Lake (Exit 27) right across the street from the Stewart's Shop (opens @ 5 a.m.) and Flanagan's Pub and Grill.  Please sign up early so we can get this deal!

 

Difficulty -- STOP, READ!

(a) Round-trip plan, returning back off the Macomb Slide (great butt slides!!!) back to Hunter's Pass Trailhead / Clear Pond winter gate: About 16.5 miles, about 3,385' ASL vertical climb.

(b)Hike back to Sounth Dix, then over Pough Peak to the "Hough-Pough Col" and down the Lillian Brook herd path, and back to Hunter's Pass Trailhead / Clear Pond winter gate: 16.9 miles RT, about 4,240' ASL vertical climb. From the col you can readily climb Hough Peak if you like; prepare for icy conditions on the final cliff section.


Google Maps Link:  Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from Manchester, NH to the Elk Lake / Clear Pond Gate (winter trailhead), from I-87 / Northway Exit 29. This link also shows the location of the Yellow Coach in Schroon Lake, NY):

Longest Estimated Drive Time From Meetup: 4 hour, 9 minutes; est. distance: 209 miles ONE WAY.


A view of the Giant Mountain wilderness from the South Dix summit.

 

UPDATES (12/28/2011 1 p.m.) -- STOP, READ!

  • Please note that if you plan to spend the night in Schroon Lake or Long Lake, you will have about a 30-minute drive to reach the trailhead.
  • We'll hike the road from the Clear Pond parking area to the Hunter's Pass trail, ascending the Slide Brook herd path to the slide; from the Macomb summit we descend into the Macomb-South Dix col, to South Dix, and then hike the round-trip to East Dix from there. At the summit of South Dix the group will decide whether we return the way we came, or climb "Poughy" to the col above the Lillian Brook drainage and herd path route ... depending on the condition of the slide, or if anyone wants to attempt to climb Hough Peak as well). 
  • Please, if you have a GPS, add a track from a previous hiker's trip to your device.  Right-Click / Download a GPX track for the entire Dix Range HERE!
  • This trip depends on conditions of the slide; if it gets very icy some may not want to attempt to climb it.

 

ESSENTIALS TO BRING -- STOP, READ!  NOTE:  Poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes and crampons are ESSENTIAL as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Snow shoes will likely be required -- stay tuned for weather updates.  Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for these items; be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!  TEST YOUR LIGHTS!!! BRING EXTRA BATTERIES!!!

ESSENTIAL RESEARCH WEB LINKS -- CLICK HERE FOR LINKS TO EXTERNAL WEB CONTENT.  BE SURE TO VIEW THE TOPO MAPS AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE -- PRINT THEM AND TAKE THEM WITH YOU!

CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR NEW YORK STATE.


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

 

Yours truly freezing her butt on at the "summit rock" on East Dix.


YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY OF OUR EVENTS. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See you there!  Julie.

 

 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: ADIRONDACK WINTER HP SERIES: Macomb, South Dix, East Dix
